newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Indonesian rupiah trapped in range trading.
newsitem.headline: Indonesian rupiah trapped in range trading.

text.p: The Indonesian rupiah was trapped in range trading between 2,600 and 2,630 to the dollar in early trade on Tuesday after strengthening earlier, dealers said.
They said the rupiah, which plunged to a record 2,665 low on Monday, rose to a high of 2,610 before easing back to the 2,627/30 level and bouncing again to 2,610/15 at 0205 GMT.
"The trend suggests possible recovery of the rupiah. We see some attempts from Singapore players to cash out from the high dollar level," one Japanese bank dealer said.
One U.S. bank dealer said the plunge of the rupiah on Monday was too excessive and was not supported by Indonesia's sound economic fundamentals.
"I think there is room for a recovery today. But the dollar is well supported at the 2,550 level and it is not easy to break the 2,600 rupiah resistance level," he said.
The U.S. bank dealer said the central bank also managed to contain speculation in the swap market as it kept liquidity supply sufficient in the money market.
Overnight rupiah was traded at 13.0/14.0 percent.
"If the 2,600 level is broken, the dollar can fall all the way down to as low as the 2,570 level," one local bank dealer said.
He said many operators could be forced to cut losses in the afternoon when the London market opens if the rupiah broke the 2,600 resistance level.

The rupiah became the latest victim of a speculative currency attack on Monday, plunging about 150 points to a historic 2,665 low against the dollar before staging a marginal recovery on central bank intervention.
But it appeared to be on the way to recovery on Tuesday, with speculators seen taking profits from the high dollar.
The rupiah/dollar spot rate was quoted at 2,603/06 at 0345 GMT from a 2,633/43 open.
Dealers said swap rates were also moving to the left on the back of sufficient liquidity supply. Short-dated swaps were traded at par level.
